item.title: IMSACON-2013 at RajaRajeswari Medical College and Hospital

item.category: Raja rajeswari medical college and hospital

Continue reading "IMSACON-2013 at RajaRajeswari Medical College and Hospital"
item.content:encoded:
It gives me great pleasure in inviting you to IMSACON-2013, the annual conference and convocation of International Medical Sciences Academy. This year, IMSACON is hosted by the Karnataka Chapter of International Medical Sciences Academy in association with the Rajarajeswari Medical College and Hospital. Rajarajeswari Medical College and Hospital is an institutional member of International Medical Sciences Academy. The International Medical Sciences Academy was established as a Global Organization on the 28th of March 1981 at New Delhi as a registered society with regions in U.K., U.S.A., Australia, Rest of Asia, Africa, Europe and India. The registered World Head Quarters of the society are situated at New Delhi.

Dr. K. Jagadeesan, Honorary Registrar and International Co-ordinator and Global Advisor of the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Glasgow, U.K. Professor Emeritus, M.G.R. Medical University, Chennai and Director, K. J. Hospital, Chennai is the present president of the Academy. International Medical Sciences Academy is the only International Body, which encompasses All Disciplines of Medicine. The Academy is an associate member of the Council for International Organization of Medical Sciences. (CIOMS) Geneva.

We have a galaxy of distinguished speakers from the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons, Glasgow, U.K. and Mayo Clinic, Rochester, U.S.A. The deliberations will be on the theme of the conference “Medical Sciences Today and Tomorrow”. The conferences are a special feature of the Academy where Academicians, Educationists, Research Scholars and Medical Professionals can present, speak and exhibit poster presentations. The student community from medical schools in Karnataka and other states of India will get a great opportunity to present papers and exhibit posters on an international platform. The postgraduate students can also become a part of the academy by enrolling as associate members.

The Conference venue is Rajarajeswari Medical College & Hospital, Bangalore. Pre-conference courses will be held on the 4th of October 2013 and Conference dates are 5th & 6th of October. After a brainstorming session of scientific deliberations, the delegates can celebrate Dusshera, the festival of good overcoming the evil, at Mysore, and carry home pleasant memories. Looking forward to meeting you in Bangalore.

Dr. Rani Devadoss
Organizing Secretary,
IMSACON 2013

Highlights of the Conference:

  • Faculty from Royal College of Physicians & Surgeons, Glasgow, U.K. will be partnering the Scientific Sessions.
  • Guest Lectures by the Faculty from Mayo Clinic Rochester U.S.A.
  • Galaxy of distinguished International & National Speakers.
  • Pre Conference Hands on Courses Workshop.
  • Five Oration Lectures.
  • Student participation by Oral & Poster presentations.
  • Convocation Ceremony.
  • Gala Dinner at Eagleton Resorts 
  • Delegates Talent Night.
  • Entertainment by RajaRajeswari Medical & Dental students.
  • Rock Band from the Capital.

 

The Royal College of Phycians & Surgeons and their team will be conducting a symposium on the Theme “Recent Advances”.

Prof. Nadey S Hakim, Surgical Director Transplant Unit, Imperial College Renal and Transplant Centre, Hammersmith Hospital, UK.

Dr. Nadey Hakims finger assisted Nephrectomy as a day care procedure will be of interest to the transplant surgeons.  A Symposium on Organ Transplantation is organized in association with Zonal Coordination Committee, Karnataka

Dr. Harvinder S Luthra. Prof. of Medicine. Mayo clinc Rochester

Dr. Harvinder Luthra, John Finn Professor of Medicine-Division of Rheumatology Mayo Clinic Rochester an Alumnus of Ludhiana Medical School with his team from Mayo, will be holding a brainstorming scientific session.

Dr. Paola Sandroni, Prof. of Neurology

Pre Conference Hands on Courses Workshop

1)  “Basic life support course of the American Heart Association” by Dr. Sanjayakumar Banakal and Team from Narayan Hrudayalaya Bangalore.

  • One day course with Audio Video aids and Hands on Practice with Mannequins.
  • On successful completion of written test and skills demonstration test the candidate will obtain a course completion card valid for 2 years worldwide.
  • Course Fee: Rs. 4,500/- (Rupees Four Thousand Five Hundred only)

2)  “Pediatric Emergency Medical Course” by Dr. Indumathi Santhanam and Team.

 

  • One day course with Audio Video aids and Hands on Practice with Mannequins.
  • Course Manual is provided.
  • Course Fee: Rs. 2,500/- (Rupees Two Thousand Five Hundred)

3)  “Heart Beat Symposium” by Dr. Yogesh Kothari and Team.

  • One day symposium to provide participants with an up to date over view of the care and management of some of the common but challenging Cardiac Conditions.
  • Course Fee: Rs. 2,500/- (Rupees Two Thousand Five Hundred)

4)  “Basic and advanced suturing technique’’ by Dr. Prema Dhanraj and Team.

  • One day interactive lecture incorporating pictures, video’s and skill working modules.
  • Course manual and material will be provided for clinical practice
  • Course is open for interns post graduate students, general practitioners and faculty   
  • Course Fee: Rs. 2,500/- (Rupees Two Thousand Five Hundred)

Five Oration Lectures

  1. Dr. Pinnamaneni Narashimarao International Oration2013.
  2. Dr. TMA Pai International Oration 2013.
  3. Dr. Uma & Dr. B.C. Bansal International Oration 2013.
  4. Dr. Pratap. C. Reddy International Oration2013.
  5. Dr. Vijay Gujral International Oration 2013.

Student participation by Oral & Poster presentations

Entertainment by RajaRajeswari Medical & Dental students

Rock Band from the Capital

Gala Dinner and Banquet at Eagleton Resorts

 

The driving force behind all this is our Chief Patron Sri A.C Shanmugam and Co Patron Sri A.C.S Arunkumar
